intro: Stenachaenium macrocephalum, commonly known as the broad-headed grass, is a perennial grass species native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and large, grass-like leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in length. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers, typical of the Poaceae family. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in open woodlands and prairies. Its botanical features make it an important component of native grassland ecosystems.
